alert.note: Alert for Clay; Norman; West Becker; Wilkin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 8:16AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Clay, southern Norman, northwestern Wilkin, west central Becker, eastern Cass, southeastern Traill and northwestern Richland Counties through 845 AM CDT... At 816 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Kelso to Harwood to near Barrie. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Kragnes, Oakport and North River around 820 AM CDT. Dilworth around 825 AM CDT. Averill, Hendrum and Glyndon around 830 AM CDT. Christine, Wolverton and Comstock around 835 AM CDT. Ada, Hawley and Hadler around 840 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Moorhead Airport and West Argusville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 29 between mile markers 40 and 100. Interstate 94 in North Dakota between mile markers 341 and 352. Interstate 94 in Minnesota between mile markers 1 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 AM CDT for southeastern North Dakota. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until noon CDT for northwestern Minnesota.
